common_issues.title: Pieces OS Account Linking and Launching Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with linking multiple accounts (Google, GitHub) and launching Pieces OS. Linking problems often involve email discrepancies or legacy system limitations. Solutions include account resets, manual linking via support, and awaiting a new authentication service. Launching issues may involve conflicting installations or OneDrive interference, addressed by deleting conflicting folders or providing logs for further diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Shareable link is not generating
related_issues.text:
Shareable link is not generating
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907584e3-3310-4866-bd26-5fbf6e371d62)
Shareable link is not generating . 
## Conversation Summary: Unable to Share Link

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (19richa) reported an issue with being unable to share a link.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific problem encountered by the user was not explicitly described.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support bot provided troubleshooting resources and similar user issues.
* Mark asked the user for their email address used to sign in.
* User reported the issue resolved but didn't specify actions related to the solution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed the issue is resolved, without specifying how it was fixed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation lacks technical details about the problem and solution. 
* It's unclear without further information whether the support team took any action that led to the fix.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of PiecesOS Support Issue

**Key Points:**

* MR-AAYU reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching.
* They provided two sets of log files.
* The problem was identified as two installations of Pieces for Developers.
* It was determined that OneDrive might be preventing PiecesOS from launching due to a folder in the OneDrive location.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was unable to launch.
* Two installations of Pieces for Developers were found.
* OneDrive might be interfering with PiecesOS due to a folder in the OneDrive location.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was advised to delete the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive.
* The user was asked to send logs from the correct location (C:\Users\{USER}\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\support\logs).
* The user was asked to provide information about their machine for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not responded to the latest message from Pieces support.
* The issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was impatient and requested a fix urgently.
* It is unclear if the user has tried deleting the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive or provided the requested information about their machine.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Conversation Summary

**Problem Identified:** 

* Johnkennyuk was unable to link his Pieces accounts using his Github and Google accounts, despite having been registered for some time. This is likely due to the different capitalization of the first letter in his emails associated with each platform, as well as a legacy system limitation handled by a soon-to-be-replaced auth provider.

**Proposed Solution:**
* Reset and merge accounts, either by linking manually through a phone call with Pieces support or using a screen recording.
* Implement a new authentication service provider that can link accounts with varying emails.

**Solution Implemented (Partially):**

* Pieces team reset johnkennyuk's Github user.
* The old auth service is still in use and couldn't link accounts due to the capitalization difference in email addresses.

**Solution Implementation Timeline:**
* The new auth service is expected in early/mid-march 2025.

**Current Outcome:**

* Temporary fix implemented, awaiting new authentication system in March to attempt linking again and avoid the capitalization mismatch issue entirely

**User Suggestion (Postpone Linking, Await New Service)**

* Due to repeated failures and the imminent arrival of the improved auth system, johnkennyuk opted to delay the linking process until March.
* Pieces support acknowledged and confirmed the delay, indicating they'll resume support when new system is ready.

This summarization focuses mainly on the key aspects and problems addressed, solutions, current situation,  and future steps, as instructed. It also condenses extraneous and redundant parts of the conversation without obscuring important details for a concise overview of the issue, attempts at solutions, and its status.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers and Pieces OS Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces for Developers and Pieces OS on Linux and Windows. Issues include dependency connection errors, cloud service connectivity problems, and general launch failures. Proposed solutions involve checking log files, verifying network connectivity, resolving potential conflicts with OneDrive, and ensuring only one instance of the application is installed.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* mariusz-kowalski is facing an issue with the Pieces desktop app on Linux.
* The bot suggests relevant resources, including past issues and documentation.
* mark-at-pieces and mack-at-pieces respond to the issue.
* They believe the issue might be related to specific Linux machines.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces desktop app is not working properly on mariusz-kowalski's Linux machine.
* The cause of the issue is unknown, but it might be related to specific Linux machines.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces requests the most recent Desktop App log file from mariusz-kowalski.
* mack-at-pieces offers a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* mariusz-kowalski has provided the log file.
* They are unable to join a video call.
* The issue is still being investigated.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was first reported on February 24, 2025.
* The conversation is ongoing. 
* The specific details of the issue and its resolution are not yet available.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) is experiencing issues with making requests to Pieces' cloud services and local models.
* The problem appears to be related to a firewall or network configuration that is blocking outgoing requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* Logs provided by Rohan did not reveal any obvious cause for the issues.
* Further investigation was needed to determine the root cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* After reviewing the logs, Mark from Pieces (@mark-at-pieces) suggested scheduling a call for further troubleshooting.
* Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th to investigate the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* During the meeting, the issue with cloud LLMs was identified as being caused by a personal OpenApi key. This was resolved by removing the key.
* The issue with local LLMs was likely due to hardware constraints. This was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation began on February 16th, 2025.
* The issue was resolved on February 25th, 2025.

**Key Points:**

* The problem was identified as two installations of Pieces for Developers.

* Two installations of Pieces for Developers were found.
* OneDrive might be interfering with PiecesOS due to a folder in the OneDrive location.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was impatient and requested a fix urgently.
* It is unclear if the user has tried deleting the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive or provided the requested information about their machine.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or connect to cloud services and local LLMs. This can be due to OneDrive interference, Pieces for Developers installation conflicts, firewall blocking outgoing requests, or hardware limitations. Solutions include deleting conflicting folders, checking firewall settings, ensuring stable internet connection, using smaller LLMs, and contacting Pieces support.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:**

* ThemePark encounters a non-dismissable overlay message in Pieces for VS Code after 10 minutes.
* The message indicates that PiecesOS is not running, even though it was before.
* This issue occurs after ThemePark launches PiecesOS, which is configured to launch on Startup.

**Key Points:**

* ThemePark is using Windows 10.
* Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop are installed.
* ThemePark suspects a timing conflict between PiecesOS updating and Pieces Desktop launching on Startup.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Mack-at-pieces suggests confirming which app is configured to launch on Startup (PiecesOS or Pieces Desktop).
* ThemePark confirms that PiecesOS is configured to launch on Startup.
* Mack-at-pieces recommends switching the startup app to Pieces Desktop to avoid the timing conflict.

**Implemented Solutions:**

* ThemePark has not yet implemented any solutions.

**Current Status:**

* The issue persists, and ThemePark is awaiting further guidance.

**Additional Information:**

* ThemePark is running Pieces for VS Code, which crashes after 10 minutes.
* The crash coincides with the non-dismissable overlay message.

**Next Steps:**

* ThemePark should try switching the startup app to Pieces Desktop and observe if the issue persists.
* If the issue remains, ThemePark should provide more details about the crash and the non-dismissable overlay message.
* Mack-at-pieces and the Pieces team can then investigate further and offer additional solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) is experiencing issues with making requests to Pieces' cloud services and local models.
* The problem appears to be related to a firewall or network configuration that is blocking outgoing requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* Logs provided by Rohan did not reveal any obvious cause for the issues.
* Further investigation was needed to determine the root cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* After reviewing the logs, Mark from Pieces (@mark-at-pieces) suggested scheduling a call for further troubleshooting.
* Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th to investigate the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* During the meeting, the issue with cloud LLMs was identified as being caused by a personal OpenApi key. This was resolved by removing the key.
* The issue with local LLMs was likely due to hardware constraints. This was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation began on February 16th, 2025.
* The issue was resolved on February 25th, 2025.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting Pieces OS to Ollama, both locally installed and through Pieces. Issues include installation failures, CUDA errors, and Pieces OS launching its own Ollama instance. Solutions involve ensuring proper installation, resolving path conflicts, and verifying CUDA configurations. Pieces support is actively engaged in troubleshooting via calls and debugging.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Issues on Pieces

**Key Points:**

* User waseem852 is unable to install Ollama on their Pieces setup.
* Installation attempts were made through various methods, including Pieces, manually, and using winget.
* Uninstalling and restarting Pieces apps and OS were attempted without success.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails regardless of the installation method used.
* Uninstalling and restarting Pieces apps and OS does not resolve the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Brian from Pieces support team offers to schedule a call to debug the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A call is scheduled to further investigate and resolve the Ollama installation problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user confirms that they have shut down both Pieces apps after uninstalling Ollama, indicating a thorough troubleshooting attempt.
* The support team member is actively engaged and willing to provide further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**User:** johnkennyuk

**Problem:** Ollama server installed with Pieces OS conflicts with their existing Ollama installation, causing CUDA errors.

**Key Points:**

* User used Winget to install Ollama originally.
* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS multiple times did not resolve the issue.
* Errors occurred when Pieces OS attempted to start its own Ollama instance.
* User suspected the issue was related to startup order.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Author suggested uninstalling Ollama and reinstalling using the OllamaSetup.exe installer.
* Author offered to help debug the issue on a video call.
* User eventually resolved the issue through multiple uninstalls and path cleanups.
* Author pushed a change in Pieces OS version 11.1.2 to address potential race conditions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User reported the issue was resolved, but later experienced it again.
* Author suggested a video call to investigate further.
* User requested future versions of Pieces OS detect and handle existing Ollama installations.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was likely caused by a conflict between the two Ollama installations and the startup order of Pieces OS.
* The author of Pieces OS was helpful in providing solutions and debugging the issue.
* The user's request for improved handling of existing Ollama installations is a valid suggestion for future development.

v11.1.2

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11

**Steps to Reproduce:**

4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.

The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.

[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) is experiencing issues with making requests to Pieces' cloud services and local models.
* The problem appears to be related to a firewall or network configuration that is blocking outgoing requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* Logs provided by Rohan did not reveal any obvious cause for the issues.
* Further investigation was needed to determine the root cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* After reviewing the logs, Mark from Pieces (@mark-at-pieces) suggested scheduling a call for further troubleshooting.
* Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th to investigate the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* During the meeting, the issue with cloud LLMs was identified as being caused by a personal OpenApi key. This was resolved by removing the key.
* The issue with local LLMs was likely due to hardware constraints. This was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation began on February 16th, 2025.
* The issue was resolved on February 25th, 2025.

common_issues.title: JetBrains Plugin and App Bugs
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the JetBrains plugin and Pieces app, including horizontal scrolling problems in code snippets, cursor visibility in the Copilot chat, and difficulties connecting to cloud services and local LLMs. Troubleshooting steps often involve checking internet connectivity, switching networks, and verifying firewall settings. Solutions may require updates from the Pieces team or adjustments to user configurations.

related_issues.title: Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
related_issues.text:
Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Horizontal scroll within a code snippet from copilot answer is buggy. I cannot scroll horizontally back and forth to see full line. I need to select text to reach end of line. Once release, my cursor wont appear to scroll left again. Horizontal scrollbar doesn't respond and I cannot select text to left. cursor changes to a drag and drop cursor.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**User:** @dotnetemmanuel

**Issue:** Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window

**Key Points:**

* The user (@dotnetemmanuel) reported that the cursor is not hiding when typing in the Copilot chat window.
* The user provided details on the issue and mentioned a related issue (#638).

**Problems Identified:**

* The cursor not hiding in the Copilot chat window can be disruptive and affect usability.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and indicated it will be investigated for a future release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is open and under investigation by the Pieces team. There is no current workaround available.

**Additional Information:**

* The user was directed to helpful resources while the issue is being resolved.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) is experiencing issues with making requests to Pieces' cloud services and local models.
* The problem appears to be related to a firewall or network configuration that is blocking outgoing requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* Logs provided by Rohan did not reveal any obvious cause for the issues.
* Further investigation was needed to determine the root cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* After reviewing the logs, Mark from Pieces (@mark-at-pieces) suggested scheduling a call for further troubleshooting.
* Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th to investigate the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* During the meeting, the issue with cloud LLMs was identified as being caused by a personal OpenApi key. This was resolved by removing the key.
* The issue with local LLMs was likely due to hardware constraints. This was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation began on February 16th, 2025.
* The issue was resolved on February 25th, 2025.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS launch and connectivity issues:** This is the most common issue reported by users, impacting both Pieces for Developers and Pieces OS on Linux and Windows. Focus on resolving conflicts with OneDrive, dependency errors, and cloud service connectivity problems.
**Improve Ollama integration with Pieces OS:** Address installation failures, CUDA errors, and conflicts with existing Ollama installations to ensure a smoother user experience.

**Investigate and resolve account linking issues:** Address the legacy system limitations preventing users from linking multiple accounts, particularly the email discrepancy issue. The implementation of the new authentication service in March should be a high priority.

**Address bugs in the JetBrains plugin and Pieces app:** Focus on resolving horizontal scrolling issues in code snippets, cursor visibility problems in the Copilot chat, and difficulties connecting to cloud services and local LLMs.
**Proactively monitor and address issues reported in the most active tickets:** This will help identify and resolve emerging issues quickly and efficiently.

**Improve communication with users regarding ongoing issues and expected resolution times:** Keep users informed about the progress being made on resolving known issues and provide clear timelines for when they can expect a fix. This will help manage user expectations and reduce frustration.

**Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation and troubleshooting guides:** Provide users with easy-to-understand resources that can help them resolve common issues on their own. This will reduce the number of support tickets submitted and free up support staff to focus on more complex issues.

**Gather user feedback on support experiences and identify areas for improvement:** Regularly solicit feedback from users on their support experiences to identify areas where the support process can be improved. This could include feedback on response times, communication clarity, and the helpfulness of provided solutions.
